agave
Interface Destination

All Known Implementing Classes:
DestinationImpl
public interface Destination

Represents the destination of a handler method. This class serves as a unifying facade for redirecting and forwarding in the Servlet API and working with request parameters.

Author:
Damian Carrillo
See Also:
Destinations.forward(), Destinations.redirect()

Method Detail

addParameter

void addParameter(java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String value)
Adds a parameter to the Destination. Multi-valued parameters are supported and will be serialized into a query string with the same parameter name and multiple values, eg: /somePath?dogs=woof&dogs=bark&cats=meow&cats=purr

Parameters:
name - the name of the parameter
value - the value of the parameter

getPath

java.lang.String getPath()

setPath

getRedirect

java.lang.Boolean getRedirect()

setRedirect

void setRedirect(java.lang.Boolean redirect)

encode

java.lang.String encode(javax.servlet.ServletContext context)
Encodes the Destination path and available parameters. The parameters have any ampersands replaced with &&amp;amp; and parameter names and their associated values are sorted (mainly for testing purposes).

Parameters:
context - the handler context that this destination is running under
Returns:
the encoded destination path and query string
